meanings.sent1: The cactus had the prickiest thorns in the whole garden.
meanings.sent2: Out of all the needles, the prickiest one was the smallest.
meanings.sent3: The porcupine thought he was the prickiest creature around.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like the prickiest thorns, piercing through his heart.
meanings.sent5: The prickiest rose in the bouquet stood out with its sharp petals.

meanings.definition: prickiest: causing a sharp, stinging sensation
meanings.sent1: The bee sting was the prickiest feeling she had ever experienced.
meanings.sent2: The icy wind was the prickiest against his exposed skin.
meanings.sent3: The spicy chili sauce left a prickiest sensation on his tongue.
meanings.sent4: The sharp rock left a prickiest mark on his palm.
meanings.sent5: The prickiest sensation shot through his body as he touched the hot pan.

meanings.sent1: He was the prickiest person in the office, always getting upset over small things.
meanings.sent2: The cat became prickiest when its tail was stepped on.
meanings.sent3: The prickiest customer at the store demanded to speak to the manager.
meanings.sent4: Her prickiest mood made everyone around her walk on eggshells.
meanings.sent5: The prickiest driver on the road honked at every little delay.
